datafield.subfield: Source record for testing field replace.

Part of a photographic survey of inner Melbourne suburbs and country areas in Central Victoria undertaken by the Committee for Urban Action (CUA) from 1970 to 1974. -- Indexed as CUAFY/M1-K12. -- Negatives are part of Fitzroy film reel 30. -- Fifteen images on three filmstrips. -- Looking across road to corner with Gertrude Street towards vacant lot surrounded by wire fence -- Double storey terrace houses with name in pediment at roof Brooks Buildings, double verandahs, one with wrought iron balustrade -- Three storey apartment building -- Number 94: Double storey terrace houses with arcuated porches -- Number 96: Looking across street towards two narrow double storey buildings -- Number 100: Looking across street towards brick facade of business: Lawson and Petersen Furniture Manufacturers -- Three single storey terrace houses, one brick with arcuated porch -- Two terraces with double verandahs -- Small single storey cottage with dormer attic window, roof damaged and window unglazed, auction sign on wall -- Looking diagonally across road towards row of small cottages adjoining large double storey dwelling with pillared portico at front door and railing fence separating porch from footpath -- Two terraces with shallow flight of steps to front doors, auction sign on one house -- Two single storey terraces with balustrades at roof and decorative pediments -- Row of terraces with gabled dormers, one in bichromic brick, two with picket fences, three with brick -- Double storey terrace with wrought iron balustrade and trim on upper verandah, pediment at roof -- Looking across intersection with Webb Street to row of terrace houses with gabled dormers.
Use of this work allowed provided the creator and SLV acknowledged.
Copyright has been assigned to the State Library of Victoria
